text: Endothelial cells stimulated by LPS express <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which plays an important role in mediating neutrophil adhesion during inflammation .

<extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is induced within 1-2 h , peaks at 4-6 h , and gradually returns to basal level by 24 h . rBPI21 , a recombinant N-terminal fragment of human <extra_id_0> bactericidal/permeability-increasing protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> BPI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , inhibited LPS - induced <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression when added at the same time as , and up to 6 h after , LPS .

text: Delayed administration of rBPI21 also affected LPS - mediated activation of the nuclear factor , NF-kappa B . Two to 4 h following LPS addition to endothelial cells , when NF-kappa B was already activated , addition of rBPI21 resulted in marked reduction of NF-kappa B detectable at 4 or 6 h .
These results indicate that endothelial activation requires continuous presence of LPS , and rBPI21 acts to reverse LPS - mediated endothelial activation by interrupting the on-going LPS signal .
